results.title: Australia's wheat
results.creator_credit: Heinz Fenke, John Gray, Kit Guyatt, Lilias Fraser, Stephen Carthew, AWB Limited and Fraser Castle Productions
results.brief_description: Provides an outline of the Australian wheat industry, a brief history and general view of growing, harvesting, bulk handling and processing, research and marketing. Shows the industry from the historical beginnings at Experiment Farm and the growing colony of New South Wales, to mechanical innovation, nationwide research and modern transport and handling. Explains the farmer’s work through each season and traces the marketing of the grain from the country silo to the consumers overseas.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Heinz Fenke, John Gray, Kit Guyatt, Lilias Fraser, Stephen Carthew, AWB Limited and Fraser Castle Productions

results.title: Australia's platypus
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Wild Life”.
A young schoolboy visits Healesville Sanctuary and joins its director (and noted Australian naturalist), Mr David Fleay, on a field trip to capture a platypus for a Western Australian sanctuary. During the excursion, details of the mammal’s physical characteristics, feeding habits, and reproduction are explained. David Fleay returns to Healesville and introduces Corrie, the first platypus bred in captivity, and his father Jack. The film shows their freshwater pool, the earthen bank where Corrie’s mother Jill built her nest in late 1943, and the wooded tunnels filled with grass hay where the platypus prefers to sleep. Also provides information on the origins of the platypus, its place in the wildlife of the Australian continent, and measures for its conservation. Recommends the following books: ‘The Platypus’ by Harry Burrel, ‘Furred Animals of Australia’ by Ellis Troughton, and ‘We Breed the Platypus’ by David Fleay. Commentary by David Low. Photography by Harry Malcolm. Sound recording by J. A. Bruce. Editing by Stanley Moore.

results.title: Australia's greatest river
results.brief_description: A study of the Murray River and the countryside and towns along its banks. Emphasizes the danger of over stocking, over cropping, and forest fires, and shows how steps are being taken to overcome these.

results.title: Australia's 1st International Girl Guides Camp
results.brief_description: The activities and amusements which made up the life of those attending the first International Girl Guides Camp to be held in Australia are shown. Guides came from many countries including Great Britain, USA and the Far East. The arrival at the camp site and settling in are followed by scenes depicting cooking, washing, singing and the other aspects of camp life. Amusements include a visit to Healesville Wild Life Sanctuary, an exhibition of boomerang throwing and national dances. The film concludes with a portrait of Lady Baden-Powell.

results.title: Australian wool textile industry
results.creator_credit: Australian Woollen and Worsted Manufacturers Association and Cine Service
results.brief_description: A detailed study of the processes involved in the manufacture of woollen and worsted fabrics. Shows sorting of wool according to length and thickness; scouring; carding; dyeing; drawing and spinning; weaving and finishing; also detection and mending of flaws in the finished material. Explains the work done by the machines involved in drawing, spinning and weaving, and compares English and French machines with those used in Australian factories. No other credits available.

results.title: Australian weekend
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Indicates some of the ways in which Australians find recreation in their weekends. The people of Sydney go surfing, yachting, hiking, fishing, or playing cricket, bowls or golf during the day, and dance on the foreshores of the harbour at night. Music but no commentary.
